subject: Clash kills Taliban commander, Afghan officials say

Clash kills Taliban commander, Afghan officials say





Top Taliban military commander Mullah Dadullah was killed in southern
Afghanistan's Helmand Province in a joint Afghan army-police operation backed
by NATO air support, the Afghan government said Sunday.





FULL STORY
















3 missing, 5 killed in attack on U.S. patrol





American troops were on the hunt in a volatile region south of Baghdad for
three members of a U.S.-led military patrol, who went missing after an
insurgent attack Saturday that killed five others.

Wildfire smoke closes interstates in Florida





Dense smoke that closed parts of two major interstate highways was expected to
keep choking Floridians and traffic until at least midmorning Sunday.





FULL STORY

Ski star's cousin kills cop, then gets killed





A cousin of skiing star Bode Miller fatally shot and ran over a police
officer, then was killed by a passer-by who grabbed the officer's gun.





FULL STORY
















Swollen river begins to recede in Missouri capital





The Missouri River neared its highest point in the state's capital city
Saturday after a week of flooding towns upstream, but hydrologists said it
wasn't nearly as bad as feared.





FULL STORY
      WATCH VIDEO
















Fort Dix arrest slices father's business





The father of one of the six men charged with plotting to massacre soldiers at
Fort Dix says the business that he's nurtured near the base for years is all
but ruined since his son's arrest.

Deadly violence erupts in Pakistan





At least 33 people have been killed during massive clashes between
pro-government supporters and opposition party members Saturday in the
southern Pakistani city of Karachi, police and intelligence sources said.





FULL STORY
      WATCH VIDEO
















3 killed in bombings in Somali capital as U.N. official visits





Wearing a flak jacket over a blue pinstriped suit, the top United Nations
humanitarian official crawled into a hut made of sticks and plastic tarp
Saturday and asked the owner how he survives in one of the world's most
violent cities.





FULL STORY
















Thousands rally for traditional family in Italy





With grandparents and children in tow, tens of thousands of families gathered
in a Rome piazza to voice their opposition to a government bill that would
give many legal rights to unmarried couples, including gay ones.





FULL STORY
















Russia rejects Kosovo independence





Russia said Saturday that it could not accept elements of a draft U.N.
resolution on Kosovo worked out by the United States and European Union
nations, maintaining its strong opposition to a Western-backed plan for the
Serbian province's independence.

Buy a house and save for retirement





Question: My wife and I are currently renting, but we'd like to buy a house.
Problem is, we happen to live in somewhat expensive area where single-family
homes cost at least $300,000. Our combined income is low and we barely have
enough savings for even a small down payment.

 SI.com 








Ian Thomsen: Nash, Stoudemire struggle as Suns start to fade





SAN ANTONIO -- This series is leaking away from Phoenix. The Suns lost Game 1
in the final minute while Steve Nash was bench-ridden with a bloodied nose.
Game 3 on Saturday was a culmination of details -- poor production from Nash
and Amare Stoudemire, and overwhelming performances from Tim Duncan and Manu
Ginobili.

HEALTH

Moms' 7 biggest driving mistakes -- and how to avoid them





Remember those plastic yellow "warning" signs people stuck on their cars back
in the '80s --	"baby on board"? Maybe it's time they came back in style. Only
this time, let's stick them on our foreheads. Because let's face it: In our
constantly rushed and sleep-deprived state, we moms often don't drive as
safely as we should. 





FULL STORY
















Transplanted heart transplanted again





Two months ago at Cedars-Sinai Medical Center in Los Angeles, California,
surgeons removed a transplanted heart from a patient who had died and
re-transplanted it in another recipient.

'Rock 'n' roll photographer' comes of age





Annie Leibovitz lopes through the blond-floored galleries at the High Museum
of Art, eyed by film stars, comedians, writers, dancers and those who have
known and loved her best.

Legendary actress defined 'classy'





Over her long and storied career, which included 12 Academy Award nominations
and a record four wins for best actress, Katharine Hepburn personified a
peculiarly American, dignified grit.
